reviews.text: Arepas reminded me of my childhood arepas, really good
Quick, simple but delicious dishes in a friendly atmosphere. Ask the staff for recommendations you can‚Äôt go wrong with stopping here before a broadway show.
Lovely place we walked into before a broadway show. Patatas bravas were a stand out, actually spicy!
Excellent ambience, good service and the food was amazing thank you for everything. We will come back soon :)
What a warm and wonderful place to spend an evening. Feels like being invited into the home of a generous host. The paella, fongo, empanadillas, and croquetas were filling and flavorful.
Food was delicious and service really friendly!
Super gluten friendly. Paella is all gluten free and numerous appetizers. Best paella I‚Äôve had outside of Valencia Spain. Definitely worth a visit.
Very tasty food in the middle of Hell's kitchen, friendly service. Were able to accommodate allergies.
Great tapas and service

Fun cozy Spanish Venezuelan Restaurant  with excellent seafood paella and sangria. Music background is just right volume for discussion.  Staff super attentive.  Quick service.  Restroom is spacious.  Daughter loves this place to meet all food intolerance needs.
The paella was delicious.

My decision to be adventurous led me to great food. The modest EZ Paella & Tapas maintains cleanliness and a warm feeling. Worker service was particularly superior. You won't leave hungry after eating here. Your money is well spent at this place.
Super tof en lekker
Really god tapas and the Flan was by far one of my favorite I‚Äôve ever had
Fire Paella, great service. Small location if party of 4 make reservation
My hubby and I love to come here for the teque√±os and pabellon! The service is also excellent and everyone is very friendly. Would recommend!
Amazing restaurant with great service from our lovely waiter Andres. Will definitely come back here again!!
Fantastic food and wonderful service. The people make this place delightful. We hope to see you expand to Virginia!
Pabell√≥n was really good! Would love to go back!

Simply #wow. Each appetizer was delicious. The lentil soup scrumptious. And the paella, out of this world. Alex and his lovely wife Lorena have created a special place in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen. Don‚Äôt wait! Go!
Great food and service!
The seafood paella and burrata are a must try. Taste is authentic and every bite will you feel at home.
You all have to try- great food and service.
Very homey small humble place but great service and great food.

I brought my Spanish mother here on the first day of our trip. It was the best place we ate in a whole week of adventuring and trying the best New York had to offer. According to her, it was the best paella she has ever had in the states. Wishing we could bring them back to Utah with us. Above and beyond service. If you‚Äôre considering stopping by, it will blow your expectations out of the water, seriously.

We went to EZ Paella & Tapas before our Broadway show and had such a great experience! I made reservations about a week in advance to be sure we‚Äôd have plenty of time, and everything worked out perfectly. The atmosphere is warm and friendly, and the service was excellent ‚Äî everyone was so helpful in explaining the menu since we weren‚Äôt familiar with Venezuelan and Spanish fusion food.

We tried two tapas ‚Äî the shrimp in garlic sauce was delicious ‚Äî and the Montaditos Venezuela, which ended up being our favorite dish of the night. We also shared the seafood paella, which was full of flavor and beautifully presented. We‚Äôre visiting from Wisconsin, and we both said we wish we had a place like this back home! Highly recommend for a fun and flavorful dinner before a show.
Food and service are great!  Delicious goblets of sangria and really cool paella burrito were highlights!
Amazing food and service. They also have amazing lunch specials. If you‚Äôre in the area, I highly recommend stopping in.
Great food and great happy hour!!

Great place to eat good tapas, with a Venezuelan twist.  I like to judge a tapas restaurant by the Spanish tortilla and this place did not disappoint.  The tortilla was fluffy. I would highly recommend the montaditas Venezuela.  Very flavorful and unique. The service was excellent and prompt. Finally, for dessert, we had the churros. Fresh and made to order.  Would come back here next time I‚Äôm in manhattan .

EZ Paella & Tapas is an absolute standout ‚Äî a warm, colorful spot where Spanish and Venezuelan flavors come together beautifully. The empanadas are perfectly golden and flaky with a creamy dipping sauce that‚Äôs downright addictive, and the arepitas topped with shredded beef, plantains, and cheese are next-level comfort food. Everything tastes freshly made and full of heart, from the first bite to the last sip of their crisp, fruit-filled sangria. The staff is friendly, the energy is vibrant, and every dish feels like it was crafted with love. A total 10/10 experience ‚Äî this place deserves all the praise!
Great food and great service.
Amazing food and great service. The owner is wonderful. Can't recommend this highly enough!
Quick and tasty pre-theater meal. Loved the chicken with peppers and pesto.
We had a wonderful dinner here, highly recommend! The service was amazing and thoughtful. Will come back again soon

My partner and I love Spanish food, so we decided to try this place. Unfortunately, the food was just okay ‚Äî it lacked flavor and presentation, which was disappointing given the high prices (we spent almost $120). There is no ‚Äúfusion‚Äù between the two cuisines.
Best paella ever, highly recommended it, very authentic! Also the tapas were delicious, warm and friendly staff. We can from San Diego craving paella and left happy. üòÉ

The food is excellent the customer was top
Tier!!!
The paella is fabulous.  Plantains and tres leches excellent as well.
Nice assortment of tapas. Staff was very sweet

We ordered from EZ Paella & Tapas for a group event, and hands down it was amazing from start to finish. The ordering process was simple and smooth, they were super accommodating with our needs, and delivery was right on time. And the food? Absolutely fantastic. Every dish was fresh, flavorful, and a total crowd-pleaser. Our group loved it, and I couldn‚Äôt recommend them more highly for anyone looking for something unique and delicious.

You'll notice the good service and taste the kitchen's skill. Staff members provide steady, reliable assistance. Their food stands out for exceptional taste. I respect what this restaurant offers. EZ Paella & Tapas provided everything needed for a great meal.

The food is phenomenal, the service was attentive, and the staff treated us like family. We had the pleasure of sitting at the chef‚Äôs table. The owners and the staff make you feel like you are eating Sunday dinner at Mom and Pop‚Äôs. Highly recommend you visit. Will come back again and again. Thank you!!!!
Quick service, fun variety of tapas different than traditional (Barcelona) Spanish tapas.

La Atencion de Cataldo fue maravillosa, tan atento, tan amable
Siempre pendiente si necesit√°bamos algo, incluso sin pedirles, no nos brindaba lo que necesit√°bamos y la comida es deliciosa. Recomiendo este lugar venimos‚Ä¶
Super rica comida, las salsas picosas estaban perfectas, no demasiado picosas pero enchilado rico! Los camarones, burratta, pollo, y paella estuvieron deliciosos!!

This restaurant earned a permanent spot in my rotation. The setting balances neatness with approachability. The value proposition works with generous portions, great taste, and attentive staff. The restaurant personnel give perfect care. You need to form your own opinion.
Great tortilla de patata and sangria! Super friendly staff!!!

i‚Äôm from Hawaii and here for work and found this nice little restaurant while walking around. went in I got to meet the owner, Alex and Anthony the cook and Andres who greeted and seated me.
AWESOME service. Very nice people and great food. Alex(owner) recommended Montaditos Venezuela to complement the Seafood Spicy Paella.
Both were really good. Highly recommend paying this place a visit. This 2 dishes filled me up.
I will definitely be coming here whenever I'm in NYC.  If you go there because you read my review please let them know why you came.
Mahalo
Great restaurant with a friendly & personal service

Ottimo ristorante per differenziare dai soliti fast food americani, prezzi ragionevoli, personale educatissimo e super competente. Il cibo molto buono! A noi √® piaciuto veramente tutto.
Location adatta per gruppi da 2 a 6 persone !
Posizione ottima a 10min a piedi da Times Square.
Lo consigliamo vivamente !

We decide to try something different as we are still celebrating our anniversary. Its our fist time here and the service was great and the food was delicious!
I had the Montaditos Venezuela and the yuquitas con chimichurri. My fiance had the Pabell√≥n criollo! The music wasn't loud ,very nice place and very clean place including the restroom

This place offers some of the best prepared Spanish and Venezuelan dishes you can have in NYC. No joke. We've ordered pretty much the entire tapas menu and everything was made or cooked to perfection. Big thumbs up to our waiter who had to deal with a big party which came with us. I highly recommend this establishment when it comes to authenticity of the two cuisines I've mentioned.

‚ÄîThe whole experience was mediocre. ü´© We ordered tapas / ham & cheese croquettes which were salty and the flavor did not hit. We also had the morsillas that looked appealing but were bland , lacked flavor and were not savory at all, also a disappointment.  For the entree we were excited to order the signature paella, that people so rave about.  The paella was an interesting one , it was not super bad but also the flavors did not wow me , it did have great amount of fresh seafood but rice was lil too heavy .  Overall this place did not impress me at all . Definitely overrated, meals were mediocre with flavors that were completely off. Seasoning was not good!  üëéüèΩüëéüèΩ

‚ÄîI had the ‚ÄòTres Leche cake for dessert which was pretty good.

Our experience at EZ Paella & Tapas was exceptional!! I enjoyed the spicy seafood paella, while my party also had the chicken paella burrito and shrimp paella burrito and we were all pleased. Not only was the food great, our peach sangria was a treat and the service was attentive and pleasant. We recommend you make your way to EZ Paella & Tapas next time you‚Äôre in the Hell‚Äôs Kitchen area or near one of their other locations!!

Every bite was outstanding. Alex (one of the owners) made recommendations for tapas, and each one was amazing. Nice vibe, excellent food, wonderful service. The spicy meatballs were especially fantastic. We also tried a sample of some delicious paella too. And we wrapped up the meal with the best tres leches cake we‚Äôve ever had. Do yourself a favor and try this great restaurant out!

EZ Paella & Tapas is a cozy, family-run spot where the couple (I didn‚Äôt ask, but I‚Äôm quite sure they are) work hard to welcome, serve, and even greet guests out on the street. Their food is best described as Venezuelan-style Spanish cuisine, likely reflecting their own roots.

This place isn‚Äôt exactly an unmissable fine-dining experience, but it‚Äôs a genuine, affordable family restaurant run with heart ‚Äî and places like this are becoming increasingly rare. As New Yorkers, we should support businesses like these and keep our city‚Äôs food scene diverse and vibrant.

After so much traveling we were really craving some paella, so we decided to try the restaurant our Uber driver recommend. We went to EZ Paella & Tapas and from the moment we walked in it felt welcoming and cozy. The menu had so many nice choices and we ended up ordering a lot of different items to try.

Everything we got was tasty but my favorite was the shrimp. The flavor was rich and fresh, and it really reminded me of the comfort meals my lola cooks back home in the Philippines. Eating it made me feel like I was back at our family table, sharing food and stories. It‚Äôs not easy to find that kind of feeling when you are far from home, so it was really special for me.

The staff were also friendly and made sure we had everything we need. The service was quick even though there were other customers, and the atmosphere was nice for relaxing after a long day. Thank you EZ Paella & Tapas for the amazing food and for making me feel close to home even when I‚Äôm far away.

I realized that I've never had Venezuelan food before so I decided to check this place out. It's a Venezuelan / Spanish fusion and everything was so tasty. We went with a few appetizers and finished it off with the seafood paella. The paella doesn't look like much but the flavors that come out of that bowl are quite bright and dynamic. There is a lot of shrimp in there which you don't see in the picture on the menu. We added chorizo to ours and I loved it. It added a nice contrast in texture since everything else had a softer feel. My friend didn't love it but I think it was a great add-on.

We ordered the half-carafe of red sangria and it was such a good choice. Good size and the flavor was pure. It didn't taste like other sangrias that have fat too many extra stuff in it.

You know I love great service. The food can be A+ but if the service is lacking, it's a huge disappointment. But out server Cataldo was amazing. He was knowledgeable, patient, and gave the best recommendations.

I really like this place. I love how small and cozy it is. Big restaurants stress me out but this place had such a nice vibe, I can't wait to go back. Thank you Cataldo for a great experience.

We walked in when they were almost closing but they opened up and made us a table. Even guided us on vegetarian fare. Dinner was delicious and dishes wiped clean by my family. Excellent service and great food!

Flew in to NYC, took a nap and this was our first mean of the day. Friendly staff, owner and service. Overall, food was excellent except we didn't get as much scallops and squids as we have expected in our seafood paella. Happy 4th of July, 2025!

I loved my experience at EZ Paella & Tapas! The service was exceptional and took care of all of our needs. The tapas were so so good! Those were definitely my favorite out of everything on the menu. I wish I could have pictured more of them here. I also ordered the Paella which was also amazing! It was very flavorful very shareable! I highly recommend coming here! You will not regret stopping by.

Lugar tranquilo, con buena atenci√≥n y la paella deliciosa (mar y tierra). Pero sobre todo la honradez, precios de acuerdo al plato, he dejado olvidado un bolso y ellos me persiguieron para entreg√°rmelo, acogedor y apacible lugar.

Lorena and the other staff were so friendly and helpful. The tapas had a creative twist and were delicious! The paella had great flavor and the flan hit the spot. Will definitely return to this hidden gem!

Absolutely outstanding! The service was excellent, and the attention to detail was impeccable. You can truly see and feel the beautiful blend of Spanish and Venezuelan cultures in everything‚Äîthe d√©cor, the food, the hospitality.

The place may be small, but it‚Äôs huge in flavor. Every single dish was tempting; I honestly wanted to try everything on the menu! From the very first bite of our appetizer, I was transported back to my home country. The teque√±os were divine, the churros delicious, the paella full of flavor, the croquettes perfectly done, and the montaditos with morcilla‚Äîamazing. The morcilla itself was packed with taste, and the garlic shrimp were incredible. We also had empanadillas de carne‚Äîeverything was so good, we wished we had room for seconds!

The sangr√≠a was spectacular, and the lemonade‚Äîreal lemonade made with real lemons‚Äîwas refreshing and delicious.

This was hands down one of the best dining experiences we've ever had. We left truly satisfied and happy. Highly recommend!

Absolutely amazing! We stopped in after seeing the Buena Vista Social Club show on Broadway with three hungry teenagers, and it was the perfect end to the night. We grabbed seats at the bar and got a front-row view of the chef working magic in the kitchen. The host was so kind‚Äîshe even helped us pass the sauces around!

We went for an all-vegetarian menu, but of course, they have everything!

The vegetarian menu was a blast to try, and we shared everything family-style. Favorites? Hard to choose!
‚Ä¢	Yuca Croquettes ‚Äì Crispy perfection with creamy garlic sauce.
‚Ä¢	Caprese Skewers ‚Äì Fresh, flavorful, and so cute.
‚Ä¢	Venezuelan Cheese Stick ‚Äì Ooey-gooey delicious.
‚Ä¢	Garden Salad ‚Äì Light and refreshing.
‚Ä¢	Veggie Paella with Spicy Caribbean Sauce ‚Äì A flavor explosion.
‚Ä¢	Pantry n‚Äô Criollo ‚Äì White rice, black beans, fried plantain (vegetarian style) ‚Äì pure comfort.
‚Ä¢	Truffle Potatoes ‚Äì The star of the night!

Dessert was just as memorable‚ÄîCr√®me Br√ªl√©e and Tres Leches that were melt-in-your-mouth good. I was barely able to snap a photo of the Tres Leches as my girls finished it so fast!

Warm atmosphere, friendly service, incredible food‚Äîcan‚Äôt wait to come back!

Loved this place! Great and unique mix of Spanish and Venezuelan food I never had even in Venezuela. The paella was delicious, tapas were so good. We particularly loved the garlic shrimp and the montadito (open face arepa with plantain, shredded beef, cheese and sauce, so good!).  And the service was simply excellent, it was quick, caring and they went above and beyond even giving us free samples. We couldn‚Äôt finish all the food!
So good to find such good option in the theater district. We‚Äôd usually avoid the area unless we‚Äôre going to the theater, but we‚Äôll definitely come back!!

The owner Lorena greeted us at the door, so welcoming and friendly.
The menu was full of so many delicious dishes and we had to make limited decisions and we‚Äôll be back to try the remaining options.

Went here for lunch today with my friend. This is a small place, nothing fancy, but food is amazing. We started with pincho caprese skewers with pesto sauce which was delicious. Red sangria and passion fruit sangria was refreshing and delicious. We shared the chicken paella with chorizo. The chorizo gave it the little bit of saltiness it needed. We finished with churros with chocolate and caramel which were  crispy on the outside and light and fluffy. Absolutely delicious! Highly recommended!

I have discovered this restaurant from watching Jon Barr‚Äôs YT videos. I love the homey vibes. The staff are friendly and accommodating. Delicious tapas and paella! Will definitely come back again to try other food

Absolutely fantastic food! 10/10 recommend the Sweet Pepper Burrata, the Tostada Chorizo Queso, and seafood Paella and OMG the house Tres Leches is hands down the best I‚Äôve ever had!! And I‚Äôve traveled the world!

I had a fantastic dining experience at Paella. I started with the soup of the day ‚Äî a creamy potato leek with haddock ‚Äî and it was absolutely delicious, rich and perfectly seasoned. I also tried the skewered octopus, which was tender, flavorful, and beautifully grilled. The service was impressively fast and friendly, making the whole experience smooth and enjoyable. Highly recommend for anyone looking for quality seafood and great service!

It‚Äôs honestly such a shame that they can absolutely nail their appetisers and give me the worst paella I‚Äôve ever had. Let‚Äôs start with the good.

The meatballs, super flavourful very crispy I highly recommend.
The funny thing with the meat on top very nice too it had sweetness, crunch and saltiness from the meats.
Meat puffs were delicious too, filling is hearty and the flavourful is wonderful.

However the paella told a different story. The rice was soggy (like really soggy) and the saffron flavour did not come through. It was weird. Peas tasted frozen and they were discoloured. The rice with the bits of chorizo (I think) made it too salty. The seafood was also not fresh, the mussels took quite a bit of effort to open and it tasted like it had been left out for hours. It was lw bad that I didn‚Äôt even finish it.

Overall, I‚Äôm just gonna put it simply, just come here for their appetisers their paella sucks.
Top notch service and amazing food! Such an amazing spot. The tequenos were better than my grandma (don‚Äôt tell her!). Thank you for making my birthday so special!!!
Good paella spot with good lunch specials. Seafood paella came out quick, ok price for the area, wish rice was bit more charred. Clean place, but mostly empty during lunch.

Saturday weekend date night... great paella, tasty appetizers, delicious desserts, and amazing sangria's of many flavors!
Service was excellent with friendly staff/servers, and the atmosphere was very cozy.
Will definitely be back for another visit and to try more of the food that this awesome restaurant has to offer.
We sat at the bar and the chef was very nice!  Food was delicious! Quesadilla was so good!
Food was amazing! Every dish we tried was absolutely delicious! Staff was super friendly and the chef was as well.

Muy rica la comida en especial muy rica. Toda recomendado 100% y las bebidas tambi√©n. As√≠ que pidan su polarcita porque sin la polar no se pueden ir que es una cerveza üç∫ bien fr√≠a helada como tiene que ser

Waooo this seafood paella with chorizo was incredible, very fresh and soft and in top of that cooked in front of my eyes. Alex keep up the great work, EZ Paella is a winner and a keeper
See you guys again in November.
Food is well prepared and delicious, tried few tapas all tasty, will come back for Paella!
Great Paella, tapas, and sangria. The owner even hooked us up with an extra free sangria which was a great surprise! For tapas I would recommend the spicy garlic shrimp or scallops.

Excelente atenci√≥n desde el inicio hasta final de Marlon, y todo el personal del restaurante üôèüòá‚Ä¶ Muy buenas porciones, calidad y sabor de la comida ‚Ä¶ soy muy cr√≠tica con la comida y a parte soy de Venezuela ‚Ä¶ fue maravilloso volver a probar una ‚Äúpaella espa√±ola de mi pa√≠s ‚Äú‚Ä¶ lo recomiendo üíØüíÉüôèüíØüòáüòáüòá üá™üá∏ üáªüá™
Ysa was such a great host for us at the chef‚Äôs table! We were so well taken care of. It felt like we were at omakase !
